title: Angular Momentum After Period of Time

content.description: The figure above represents a stick of uniform density that is attached to a pivot at the right end and has equally spaced marks along its length. Any one or a combination of the four forces shown can be exerted on the stick as indicated.
content.question: All four forces are exerted on the stick that is initially at rest. What is the angular momentum of the stick after <math alttext="2.0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="159 kilogram meters squared per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>150</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="450 kilogram meters squared per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>450</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="650 kilogram meters squared per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>650</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="750 kilogram meters squared per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>750</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="159 kilogram meters squared per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>150</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
